alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Indiana; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 4:11PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA... SOUTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHEASTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EST... At 410 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Vandergrift to Clairton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Any accumulation of small hail could lead to slick roadways0. Locations impacted include... McKeesport, Jeannette, Vandergrift, Apollo, Plum, West Mifflin, Murrysville, Jefferson Hills, North Versailles, White Oak, Clairton, Duquesne, Turtle Creek, Glassport, Irwin, Pitcairn, and Manor. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 55 and 67. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 83 and 84. && MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
